sentence.Network_en: He did not bother to punctuate the telegraph message.

sentence.Network_cn: 我们尚未学会正确使用标点符号.

sentence.Network_en: He made gestures to punctuate his speech.
sentence.Network_cn: 他打手势来强调他的讲话.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'point out'): from medieval Latin punctuat- 'brought to a point', from the verb punctuare, from punctum 'a point'

entry.def: If an activity or situation is punctuated by particular things, it is interrupted by them at intervals.

example.ex: The silence of the night was punctuated by the distant rumble of traffic.
example.tran: 夜晚的宁静不时被远处车辆的隆隆声打断。

means.word_mean: 2. to stress, single out as important;

sentences.sentence: "Dr. Jones emphasizes exercise in addition to a change in diet"
"Her sharp questions punctuated the speaker's drone"

auth_sentence.content: Conversations and a crescendo of coughing punctuate the larghetto.
auth_sentence.res_content: Conversations and a crescendo of coughing punctuate the larghetto.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Conversations and a crescendo of coughing punctuate the larghetto.

auth_sentence.content: Then we had pulsatile evolution, now punctuate evolution.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then we had pulsatile evolution, now punctuate evolution.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then we had pulsatile evolution, now punctuate evolution.

stems_affixes.word_buile: punct点,变尖,指,针+ilious→[做事]点滴不漏→小心的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 严守时刻的,准时的,正点的
stems_affixes.word_buile: punct点,变尖,指,针+ual……的→到点上→准点的
pung=punct点,变尖,指,针+ent……的→尖的→尖锐的
acu尖+punct点+ure表名词→用尖[针]点→针炙
com全部+punct点,变尖,指,针+ion表名词→全身像针刺一样→懊悔
punctual[adj.严守时刻的,准时的,正点的]+ity表名词→n.准时
punctuate[v.加标点于;不时打断]+ion表名词→punctuation标点
punct点,变尖,指,针+ure表名词→点[进去]→刺穿
punct点,变尖,指,针+uate=ate表动词→加上点→加标点
punct点,变尖,指,针+ure表名词→点[进去]→刺穿

means.word_mean: (在文字中)加标点符号,加标点

sentences.en: to punctuate a piece of writing
We have not yet learned to punctuate correctly.
sentences.cn: 我们尚未学会正确使用标点符号。

sentences.en: He did not bother to punctuate the telegraph message.
sentences.cn: 他没有费心在电文中加标点。

sentences.en: The audience punctuated his speech by outbursts of applause.
sentences.cn: 听众不时以阵阵掌声打断他的讲话。

sentences.en: a silence punctuated only by the occasional sniff from the children
sentences.cn: 只有偶尔被孩子们吸鼻子的声音打破的寂静

sentences.en: His speech was punctuated by catcalls.
